name: Hampton Inn & Suites By Hilton Calgary- University Northwest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. The welcome was very friendly and they were always ready to help with a recommendation for a meal. Try the Diner 5 mins walk away. Can't think what it was called, the hotel will know.The Red Lobster was not up to much but the home cooking at the diner can be recommended. I loved the swimming pool at the hotel and they are in an excellent location. You MUST make the 90 mile trip to Drumheller to visit the Royal Tyrrell Museum of Paleantology. It is a World class dinosaur museum set in the badlands. An excellent day out and for $10 an absolute bargain. The trip across the Canadian Prairies to get there is also very interesting.
reviews.title: Good stay in Calgary

reviews.text: We stayed here on a quick overnight in Calgary en route to the Rockies.
reviews.title: Fabulous budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although it was the cheapest hotel on our trip it had the friendliest welcome we came across with staff who clearly took pride in the hotel
reviews.title: Good hotel in convenient location, excellent free breakfast

likes.liked: — Clean comfortable room ,free breakfast, free wifi, pool, helpful staff, secure underground parking
likes.disliked: — No views, not much choice of eating places locally

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and comfortable and the free breakfast the best we came across all trip
reviews.title: A Hampton in transition?

reviews.text: Our only downside was the area seemed to attract the odd troublesome nutter and our late arrival combined with a wrong turn into the next hotel car park meant two dicey drunk men tried to flag us down and shout at us, which left us a bit shaken up on arrival. The area looked safe the next morning however, but I can't help thinking that the secure car park and key entry lift shows this was not an isolated incident. I hope I'm wrong though as this really was a lovely hotel for the price with the best staff.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: Second stay at this hotel. A few minor problems but nothing major. All problems seem to come from the front desk staff. The staff could be more customer service sensitive. I got the distinct impression that customers were not high on the list. Just the attitudes. Also, the issue of cigarette smoking. We were on a non-smoking floor but the smell of cigarette smoke actually woke us up twice in one night. it was disgusting. I asked the front desk if the hotel would soon go non-smoking but no one would answer my question. Not could not answer,but would not answer. They were busy doing something else. Yes, the front desk staff really needs to get some re-training.
reviews.title: Front desk staff not as friendly or helpful as should be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I like the cleanliness and the location, but the front desk really puts me off the hotel. It may influence us on a return visit.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.text: I loved this hotel and will stay here every time I need a hotel in Calgary but do not want to stay downtown (it is far from downtown, but I was attending meetings at the University which is quite close).
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.text: The property was tastefully decorated (lobby and rooms) and very clean. The hotel staff were very courteous and helpful. I was able to store my luggage during the day before I checked in that evening. I got a phone call in my room that evening, inquiring if everything was to my satisfaction, which I thought was an extra-special touch.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, there was no room service or restaurant in this hotel, which would be its only downside. However, they had a wonderful continental breakfast with fresh fruit salad, delicious coffee, pastries, toast, waffles, etc. You name it, they had it, and it was far more than just stale muffins, toast and jam that some hotels like to call a continental breakfast.
reviews.title: good value, nice place to stay

reviews.text: Location: The hotel is just off Crowchild Trail in Motel Village. It's a five minute walk from the C-Train station and close to the university, Foothills Hospital and Alberta Children's Hospital.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Calgary's Motel Village
Nice little gem
reviews.text: Parking: Free underground parking. Make sure you check in before going to the parkade as you need a key to get out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in: My only experience is with early evening check-ins. The night manager (Tony) is a pro and the other staff were friendly --almost too much so, as I'm not fond of making small talk after a long day and long drive.
reviews.title: Return travellers

reviews.text: Rooms: Clean and spacious, except I find the jacuzzi suite cramped. Beds are quite comfortable. There are fridges and microwaves in the smaller rooms and kitchenettes in the larger suites.
reviews.title: Best of the lot in Motel Village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Washrooms: Small to standard size. Basic toiletries are provided.
reviews.title: Clean spacious rooms
Im left...unimpressed
reviews.text: I rely on the ratings/comments from trip advisor to make my travel plans so when you rate a hotel at #2 in a large city...I expect it to be ....good......at least clean

The room was a very standard/acceptable layout, but what first caught our attention was the 'crater like' apperance of the top of the beds ...those comforters have lived a good life and should really be retired/replaced
reviews.title: Great Recommendation

reviews.text: This drew me toward the bed where I found my self having a closer look at the pillows on one of the beds. I immediately noticed a dried stain from ??? something and a black hair.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay near University

likes.disliked: — It was quite expensive (more than CAD$ 260 per night).

reviews.text: All my hair is white...so now I'm down at the front desk asking if we can have another room assignment.
reviews.title: Stampede 2008 - Very pleased with the Hampton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rather than 'show' me another room they just handed me a card key and sent me along to check out the room on my own...twice to the room and twice the key wouldn't work...finally I said just get me some fresh pillows and we'll keep the room.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Clean and Secure in Motel Village

aka: Hampton Inn And Suites By Hilton Calgary- University Northwest
description: Tastefully decorated and appointed rooms and suites. Large lobby with gas fireplace. Continental breakfast with hot items in Breakfast area. Swimming pool with waterslide, hot tub and fitness area. Free WiFi, business centre Underground parking.
